message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty with data from the World Bank's Global Findex 2017 and the International Poverty Line Database.", "dataset": ["Global Findex 2017", "International Poverty Line Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses randomized controlled trials of a nutrition intervention in low-income Indian households, leveraging the data from the Tata-Chronicle database.", "dataset": ["Tata-Chronicle database"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Our study examines the impact of extractive industry operations on local economies using firm-level data and census data from Nigeria and Angola.", "dataset": ["firm-level data", "census data from Nigeria and Angola"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilizes two datasets, one on government revenues and expenditures and one on voter behavior to investigate how electoral systems affect taxation in Latin America.", "dataset": ["government revenues and expenditures", "voter behavior"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from the Living Standards and Measurement Study (LSMS), this study investigates the determinants of women's employment in rural Zambia.", "dataset": ["Living Standards and Measurement Study (LSMS)"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite imagery data with demographic health survey data to assess the association between air pollution and child mortality in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "demographic health survey data"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on panel data from the National Survey of Manufacturing Plants (NSMP) and the Innovation Follow-up Survey conducted by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry.", "dataset": ["National Survey of Manufacturing Plants (NSMP)", "Innovation Follow-up Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the General Household Survey conducted by the Statistics South Africa, we analyze the effect of household headship on educational attainment of women in South Africa.", "dataset": ["General Household Survey", "Statistics South Africa"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data for 60 countries from 1990 to 2017 and apply dynamic panel techniques to assess cross-country differences in the relationship between trade openness and income inequality.", "dataset": ["panel data for 60 countries from 1990 to 2017"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the determinants of entrepreneurship in West African countries using multiple datasets including household surveys, firm surveys, and census data.", "dataset": ["household surveys", "firm surveys", "census data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty with data from the World Bank's Global Findex 2017 and the International Poverty Line Database.", "dataset":
